block.p: Fiona Robertine Capuano, a daughter of Daisy and Laurence Capuano of Manhattan, and David Scott Goldberg, a son of Norma and Norman Goldberg of Roslyn Heights, N.Y., are to be married this evening. Rabbi Michael White is to officiate at the Brooklyn Botanic Garden.

Ms. Capuano, 26, will keep her name. She was until recently an editorial assistant with Bantam Dell Publishing in Manhattan. She graduated from New York University. Her father is an owner and president of Zecron Textiles, a textile importer in Brooklyn.

Ms. Capuano, 26, will keep her name. She was until recently an editorial assistant with Bantam Dell Publishing in Manhattan. She graduated from New York University. Her father is an owner and president of Zecron Textiles, a textile importer in Brooklyn.

Mr. Goldberg, 31, is a creative director responsible for developing programming ideas for BNNtv.com, a television production company in Manhattan, and CameraPlanet.com, a Web site under development to broadcast programs shot by viewers. He also helped produce ''Every Parent's Nightmare,'' a child care documentary that was broadcast in March on the Arts & Entertainment Network. He graduated from Skidmore College.

His father is the executive vice president and chief operating officer of Fortunoff, the retail chain based in Westbury, N.Y. The bridegroom's mother works for the Cablevision Systems Corporation as a liaison to schools on Long Island.
